history.title: Our History
history.subtitle: A journey of compassion and dedication.
history.paragraph1: My name is Luiza. I am the founder of CrossCharity.
history.paragraph2: Since childhood, I very clearly felt how important it is to be loved, to be cared for, to have support. And equally, how painful it is when these things are lacking. Especially for children.
history.paragraph3: I was always drawn to those who had it a little harder. I volunteered. I visited orphanages. I hugged, played, just being there. And when I had a stable income - I started helping financially. First occasionally. Then more regularly. Especially children from disadvantaged families who lack even basic necessities - not to mention warmth.
history.paragraph4: And then a personal story happened in my life. A very important one. Perhaps I'll share it later. But it was this experience that became the moment when everything fell into place. That's when CrossCharity was born.
history.paragraph5: For the first two and a half years, the foundation worked quietly. Without a website, without social media pages, without publicity. Only with my personal funds, friendly partnerships, and support from friends who believed, trusted, and helped with whatever they could.
history.paragraph6: Now the foundation has more than 40 people. This is not just a team - these are people who live this cause every day. CrossCharity was never about image or profit. It's about pain. About responsibility. About a deep understanding that a catastrophe can happen in children's lives - and no one but us can be there for them.
history.paragraph7: We act quietly. But seriously. And always - with love.

story.title: LUIZA founder of the foundation
story.subtitle: A personal story of dedication
story.content: From childhood, I felt how important it is to help those who are going through difficult times. I was drawn to those who needed help more than others. After my personal story of volunteering, I founded CrossCharity. In the first year and a half, the fund worked in silence, helping over 40 people. It's not about numbers. It's about being there for others.
